result.execSummary:
Myrick Dontae Stevens was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Myrick Dontae Stevens was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Myrick Dontae Stevens

records.addlTxt: Defendant Myrick Dontae Stevens in court, in custody.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Myrick Dontae Stevens. Defendant waives extradition. Waiver signed. Court approves and signs waiver.
Extradition hearing on May 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Extradition hearing on May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Myrick Dontae Stevens appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Myrick Dontae Stevens. Attorney Bartelt has discussed extradition with defendant and he would like to waive extradition. Extradition hearing set.
Extradition hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Extradition hearing on May 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Extradition hearing on May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Myrick Dontae Stevens in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Peter Bartelt appeared by phone. Attorney Pozorski swears to extradition complaint. Court explains extradition rights, complaint, and right to counsel. Defendant heard. Court refers defendant to SPD. State requests $500 cash bond. Extradition hearing set.
